Reviews.Title: The best Blackberry ever built
Reviews.Author: carevalo
Reviews.Content: I have owned 5 Blackberry devices in a period of 6 years.  The one I liked the most was the Blackberry Bold 9000.  The last I owned was the Blackberry Torch 9800 and it was the worst nightmare I ever had in my professional life.  So I started looking desperately for another device, even seriously considered going back to the old and known Bold 9000 but they are not built anymore.  I do not like touchscreen, I do NOT need touchscreen, I type very fast, "I need tools, not toys".So, I stumbled upon the Bold 9900 with a certain hesitation.  The "faster processor", "touchscreen" ads did not touch my heart, I was already heartbroken with the Torch.  But I bought it.  What a pleasant surprise !  It was BETTER than the Bold 9000, but improved !  Instead of the trackball, the touchpad now is a real update, the screen size is just perfect, the combination of phone, internet, email, GPS, compass, etc., makes sense for a power user like me, taking care of hundreds of customers with just one device for emails, SMS, phone calls, instant messages.  It is blazingly fast, sharp screen, wow !I am seriously considering buying another one before RIM decides to update it and scrap the good job they did with this one.  It always happens to multinational companies that some marketing initiative designed to supposedly innovate and bring better numbers destroys a company's own market. Those experiments work well with PowerPoint presentations, endless conference calls with Engineering departments and hundreds of layers of middle managers but end up being disasters with the consumer.  I am crossing my fingers so that the good people working at RIM today stay there and keep providing us with good tools.Make no mistake.  This phone will reinstate RIM's reputation as the prime manufacturer of business-oriented smartphones.  Bravo!

Not even working with other SIM cards, probably a phone that did not pass the quality controls was sold by this seller, if not a refurbished one sold as new! Beware!

Reviews.Title: Not 9900 - They sent me 9930 instead
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Beware with Deal Grabbers, i placed an order with them for a Blackberry 9900 - unlocked and they sent me a Blackberry phone in a box that i never seen before for a 99xx series. Outside the box, they pasted a sticky Blackberry - 9900 Unlocked and a printed MEI ID. Surprisingly when i opened the box, i saw a Verizon phone - which generally CDMA (9900 is purely GSM). Then i start the device and see in the settings, it was a Blackberry 9930 instead of 9900. I was very upset in the begining but i have thought that they may made a mistake when packing. But then when i replace the back cover and the battery to check the MEI ID printed on, i found that the MEI ID was exactly the same with the one on the sticky note on box. Deal Grabbers has done it on purpose, they fake the device (9930 which they are selling at the about $40 cheaper than the 9900). Very upset about the way they cheating customer.

Reviews.Title: Good phone, but I expected less freezings
Reviews.Author: Diego Rodriguez "Diego R."
Reviews.Content: I've had this phone for almost a month now. It works great on my carrier (Tigo Colombia) up to "4G" (Not LTE).When I first opened the box I found the cellphone with charger and the BB case. Everything good. I was upgrading from a 9320. The speed is very notable compared to my old one and I love the touch screen while also having a physical keyboard. This is a great BB.It sometime gets stuck and freezes (Just like any other BB) but less often. I guess that's software side.I'm really enjoying the BB, looking forward the BB 10 with Alpha.

Reviews.Content: I have been using the blackberry 9860 and just shifted to the Bold 9900, apart from the physical qwerty key pad both phones are great. but if you are a chat fun then the bold 9900 is the best. am only disappointed with two things, first my bold 9900 did not come with the mobile hotspot meaning i will have to upgrade so application which i do't know where. and secondly which as become common with most phones, the battery life is just to short, currently my battery can only stay for 14-18 hours even-though am mostly not chatting. but apart from the battery its a great phone and as usual the product was delivered as per instructions.

Reviews.Title: Blackberry 9900 International
Reviews.Author: Ntuuse
Reviews.Content: Picking the phone I like from Amazon.com was quite a pleasant experience. No lines and no push from sales. The selected supplier was quick to confirm the sale and delivered the product in record time. The product is new as advertised and works perfectly. I have had three generations of Blackberrys this is the best. Only one requst: find a way to provide us a full screen without scrificing accurate typing. Quite a challenge but with Tablets hitting the market, Nokia, Apple and Samsung selling full screen phones, Blackberry cannot afford remaoining behind. I know a full screen version is available on Verizon but many of us love the un-locked International phone for travel. Ntuuse.

Reviews.Title: phone is data locked and the seller nor the carrier cannot fix it
Reviews.Author: TW
Reviews.Content: READ the reviews. Phone is not fully unlocked! This was my 2nd bold 5. Had a 9930 and it got wet so I bought a 9900 thinking it would be all good and dandy. I bought the phone, left USA because I had to work in the caribbean and after 2days I could not browse. Called the mobile provider here and they said it was data locked. Doing my own tests I realised that if I wasn't on a wifi network I could not do anything with this phone. Emailed the seller, they did NOTHING. Called tmobile they could not unlock the phone. Know what I did? Threw it in da trash and bought a galaxy s3! Seller made me hate blackberry's. Will never buy online again!

Reviews.Title: Good but less than I expected
Reviews.Author: Cecly Ann Mitchell
Reviews.Content: Had a lot of problems setting up this device, it was not out of the box working. I could not get emails via bridge to my BBPlayBook. Found out that AT&T; the brand on this international unlocked phone had blocked Bridge function with this device. Finally had to take the device into the local provider to resolve that situation. Ask a lot of questions before you purchase.
